Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that El Chapo never testified or named any Democrats he paid off during his trial.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the courtroom was closed when El Chapo started naming Democrats he paid off.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that El Chapo named Democrats he paid off during his trial, which is not supported by any evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that El Chapo never testified or named any Democrats he paid off during his trial.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that the courtroom was closed, when in fact, the trial received widespread media coverage and was never abruptly closed off.
Understate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim understates any aspect of the situation.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting false information and ignoring the facts of the trial.
9: Not applicable: The claim does not fall under these biases.
